physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient, Mr. T, exhibited obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) symptoms as severe contaminations obsessions and washing compulsions. Prior to deep brain stimulation (DBS), the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale score was 32.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After DBS treatment, Mr. Tâ€™s Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale score decreased to 10, indicating significant improvement in his OCD symptoms.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 37-year-old man with spinocerebellar ataxia type 10 exhibited new-onset psychosis, initially with delusions and later developing visual illusions, hallucinations, and impulsive violence.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The psychiatric symptoms initially remitted after treatment with risperidone but later progressed despite medication adherence, leading to the development of more severe symptoms.
